citation.article-title: Proposal of the genera Anaerococcus gen. nov., Peptoniphilus gen. nov. and Gallicola gen. nov. for members of the genus Peptostreptococcus.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Anaerococcus lactolyticus comb. nov.
Basonym: Peptostreptococcus lactolyticus Li et al. 1992.
Isolated from vaginal discharges and ovarian abscesses.
Negative for indole, alkaline phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase and coagulase.
Acid from glucose, lactose and mannose.
Raffinose and ribose are not fermented.
Major metabolic end-product from PYG is butyric acid.
A full description is given by Li et al. (1992).
Descriptions of major saccharolytic and proteolytic enzymes are given by Murdoch (1998).
Differential characteristics from other members of the genus are given in Table 3.
The DNA G+C content is 30-34 mol%.
